basic.floral_language:
Pailulacaria afra var.foliis-variegatis
Floriography: beautiful, vigorous, delicate
Is a special variety of Portulacaria afra, has an elegant plant form, fleshy thin leaves in nearly a heart shape, fresh green and marked by white or yellow patches, with abundant sunlight, stems turn purple red and leaf edges turn pink, grows fast and can be trimmed frequently for different shapes. 
Likes abundant sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, light pink color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, pale pink
basic.color: Leaf color green, with white or yellow marks, with adequate light leaf edges turning to pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
